SEARCH
Module se1.bestellsystem
Package application

Class Runtime

Object
Runtime
public class Runtime extends Object
A Runtime initializes the Java-environment before the application runs. This includes tasks of:
  1. Load the application configuration file: application.properties from a CLASSPATH folder in the filesystem or from a .jar file.
  2. Load the logger configuration file: log4j2.properties from a CLASSPATH folder in the filesystem or from a .jar file and initialize the logging system.
  3. Scan classes of the application to create bean objects using the getBean() method. Beans are objects that are created and managed by Runtime.
An example is a bean that implements the Runtime.Runnable interface. An implementation class is selected during class-scan and instantiated. Runtime then invokes run(Properties properties, String[] args) passing properties and args as entry point to the application.

If multiple implementation classes exist matching a requested interface, Runtime applies a selection policy:

  1. Select by the highest Runtime.Bean priority annotation provided with an implementation class.
  2. Select the deepest class in an inheritance path.
Version:
"C4-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT"
Author:
"sgraupner"

    The @Bean(priority=value) annotation prioritizes the selection of Bean implementation classes.
    static interface 
    Runtime.Runnable
    Interface an implementation class must implement for creating the Runtime.Runnable bean as entry point for the application.
